data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Remove the use of python_cmake_module (#26)

* Stop using python_cmake_module.

We really don't need it anymore, and can just use the
builtin find_package(Python3).

Note that this requires us to patch upstream orocos
to use find_package(Python3), rather than find_package(Python).

* Set hints to find the python version we actually want.

The comment in the commit explains the reasoning behind it.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@gmail.com>

data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Changelog.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@gmail.com>

data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Ensure that orocos_kdl_vendor doesn't accidentally find itself. (#27)

When initially building the orocos_kdl_vendor package (on platforms
where it actually builds), it turns out that it places a
valid cmake configuration in the build directory.  In turn,
that means that a subsequent rebuild will find this configuration
in the build directory, and throw the rest of the logic off.
This only seems to be a problem with CMake 3.29 and later, though
I can't say exactly why at the moment.

Workaround this problem by writing the configuration out to a
temporary file, and then moving it into the final place with
the final name.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@gmail.com>

data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Update to the latest orocos_kdl_kinematics commit. (#25)

* Update to the latest orocos_kdl_kinematics commit.

The main reason to do it is to quiet down PythonInterp
warnings (which are removed in the latest), but also
to just generally keep up.

* Add in a patch for Windows Debug.

Otherwise building in Debug mode fails.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@gmail.com>

data.author: Jacob Perron
data.message:
Workaround pybind11 CMake error (#9)

We can avoid an upstream issue with pybind11 by finding Python3 before PyKDL tries to find pybind11.
Same as patches being applied in other ROS packages, e.g. https://github.com/ros2/rosbag2/pull/945.

Signed-off-by: Jacob Perron <jacob@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Make sure to quote orocos variables when setting targets. (#12)

If the variables happen to have semicolons in them, then an
unquoted version means that we get CMake errors about
set_target_properties having the wrong number of arguments.
Make sure to quote all of the variables.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Jacob Perron
data.message:
Install PyKDL module where ament expects

Skip the install step for the external project and install the build artifact directly.
Unforunately, we can't call ament_python_install_module() directly since the file is generated
during the cmake build step. Instead I copied the necessary parts of ament_python_install_module()
including registering the environment hook.
